title: Overdose Prevention Week, 2025
summary: The document is a presidential proclamation declaring August 31 through September 6, 2025, as Overdose Prevention Week. It highlights the severe impact of the drug overdose crisis in the United States, noting that over 80,000 people have died from overdoses in the past year. The proclamation emphasizes the administration's efforts to combat the crisis, including the signing of the HALT Fentanyl Act, designating cartels as foreign terrorist organizations, and expanding the southern border wall. The president calls on all Americans to observe the week with activities that raise awareness about the opioid and drug overdose epidemic and to consider follow-up actions to address the issue.
